com.durbha.jc.pwhasher.util

Class ThreadPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.durbha.jc.pwhasher.util.ThreadPool

  • public class ThreadPool
extends java.lang.Object
    A Thread pool implementation. It essentially provides two things.
    1. Create threads based on the number of threads parameter
    2. Add an incoming request to a BlockingQueue, which is then polled by the individual threads, created above

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadPool

        public ThreadPool(int noOfThreads,
                  int maxCapacity)
        Create the given number of threads, and a BlockingQueue based on the maxCapacity
        Parameters:
        noOfThreads - Number of threads to create
        maxCapacity - Maximum capacity of the Queue, after this, any request to execute(Runnable) will throw a IllegalStateException.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.Runnable task)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Execute a given runnable. Essentially, this will be added to the Queue, which is polled by the individual threads.

        If the queue reaches the limit, then an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        task - Runnable that needs to be executed by a thread
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If either the application is stopped, or the queue is full

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Call this to stop all threads
